sub_title: Makes things happen and gets things done. Innovative, entrepreneurial, unflinchingly empathic.
summary:
Frank Hilbrands works on things that matter. He builds common ground between people and communities as a basis for working on shared interests. He overcomes initial mistrust between authorities, civil organizations, and vulnerable groups. This allows him to create lasting impact in neighborhoods and cities through participatory planning and management of tailor-made revenue-generating activities.

Frank's roles vary from community builder and social entrepreneur to boardroom advisor, intervention designer and programme manager. His broad experience allows him to get to the point quickly and deliver results with minimal lead time or supervision.

Both methodical and creative, he tenaciously turns ideas and opportunities into plans and partnerships, aligning interests and funding. Frank enjoys skills building as well as building teams and methods. He brings out the best in people, teams and organizations.

Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Comoros, Congo RDC, Ivory Coast, Czech Republic, Germany, Ghana, Iraq, Kenya, Madagascar, Mauritania, Morocco, Namibia, Netherlands, Niger, Nigeria, Rwanda, Senegal, Togo, Tunisia, Turkey, Uganda.

ùóûùó≤ùòÜ ùó§ùòÇùóÆùóπùó∂ùó≥ùó∂ùó∞ùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóªùòÄ
Thirty years of partnership building and promotion of transparency in and between government, civil society and media. Promotion of dialogue between government and marginalized groups. Backstopping for networks in Eastern Europe and West Africa.

Strong evaluator, even-handed assessor, budgeteer, CCM strengthening, civil society implication, pre-signature work, grant management, quality assurance. Strong skills in capacity building, training design and implementation, large proposal development.

Experience in EU, UN, USAID, GFATM and bi-lateral project implementation and evaluation. Seasoned social entrepreneur with experience in social marketing, market studies, liaison between public and private partners. Planning and implementing sustainable resilient urban communities facilitating appropriate data collection and analysis.

Extensive experience with youth & adolescents, commercial sex workers, entrepreneurs, men having sex with men, intravenous drug users, internally displaced persons, Islamic and Christian religious & traditional leaders.
